data.title: STARHIKER: A NOVEL
data.meta_description: New York, Hagerstown, San Francisco, London: Harper & Row, Publishers, 1977 . Octavo, cloth-backed boards. First edition. The picaresque space adventures of a minstrel from a future devolved Earth ruled by a race of benevolent despots called the Hrau who stows away on one of their ships to seek truth and and the company of kindred spirits on other worlds. The author's first SF novel. A fine copy in fine dust jacket.
data.text:
Dann, Jack. STARHIKER: A NOVEL. New York, Hagerstown, San Francisco, London: Harper & Row, Publishers, [1977]. Octavo, cloth-backed boards. First edition. The picaresque space adventures of a minstrel from a future devolved Earth ruled by a race of benevolent despots called the Hrau who stows away on one of their ships to seek "truth and and the company of kindred spirits" on other worlds. The author's first SF novel. A fine copy in fine dust jacket. (#23087).

Price: $25.00
